question: Q1. The dimension of e-commerce that enables commerce across national boundaries is called_______.?
Q2. E-commerce technologies have improved upon traditional commerce technologies in______?
Q3. Which one of the following is not one of the major types of e-commerce?
Q4. Compared to B2C e-commerce, B2B e-commerce is ______?
Q5. Which of the following is not considered to be one of the three phases of e-commerce?
Q6. The idealistic market envisioned at the outset of the development of e-commerce is called a ______?
Q7. The primary source of financing during the early years of e-commerce was _______.?
Q8. The type of firms that benefited the most during the consolidation period of e-commerce were _______.?
Q9. All of the following are technologies used to gather information about you online except ______?
Q10. A _________ is the set of planned activities designed to result in a profit in a marketplace?
Q11. Which of the following is not a key element of a business model?
Q12. The source of revenue in a subscription revenue model is _____?
Q13. Which of the following is an example of a portal?
Q14. All of the following are major B2C business models except ______?
Q15. The _________ business model involves an independently owned vertical digital marketplace for direct inputs?
Q16. Compared to Internet users, the number of cell phone subscribers is _________?
Q17.  Industry structure is defined as _____?
Q18. The area of actual or potential commercial value in which a company intends to operate is a _______?
Q19. A perfect market is one in which _____?
Q20. Which of the following is not a horizontal portal?
Q21.  A situation where there are no differences among products or services, and the only basis of choosing products is price is known as ______.?
Q22.  A strategy designed to compete in all markets around the globe is called a _____ strategy?
Q23. Which of the following is not one of the stages of the development of the Internet?
Q24. In 1961, __________ published a paper on packet switching networks?
Q25. The component of TCP/IP that provides the Internet's addressing scheme and is responsible for the actual delivery of packets is ______?
options: Fees from advertisers in exchange for advertisements.
Fees from subscribers in exchange for access to content or services.
Fees for enabling or execution a transaction.
The nature of the players in an industry and their relative bargaining power
A set of plans for achieving long term returns on the capital invested in a business firm
Set of planned activities designed to result in a profit in a marketplace.
How a company's product or service fulfills the needs of customers.
One firm develops an advantage based on a factor of production that other firms cannot purchase
One participant in the market has more resources than the others
There are no competitive advantages or asymmetries because all firms have equal access to all the factors to production
Competition is at a minimum, as each niche market within an industry is served by the company with the greatest competitive advantage
